page.title: 15Education Stanton School
page.content: The plaque beneath the bell tower says that the school was built in 1879. It is an old fashioned building with high ceilings and stone mullioned windows - too high to see through. There are 43 five to eleven year old children at our school, from Stanton, Stanton Lees, Pilough, Congreave and Birchover. We begin with assembly. We sing hymns and have prayers. Then we do mathematics and language work. We have science and topic work, singing, art and craft, games, swimming and drama. At play time we skip, play hopscotch, 'elastics' and football. In winter we make snowmen and barracades for war games. From our playground we can see Haddon Hall. We have special Christmas and Harvest Services, a Summer Concert, a Sports Day and inter school events. We go on several outings. I like school.
